publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2143 Angus MacKay: Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill: Financial Resolution—That the Parliament, for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill, agrees to any increase in expenditure payable out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund in consequence of the Act. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace*, Iain Gray*, Peter Peacock*

S1M-2143 Angus MacKay: Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill: Financial Resolution-That the Parliament, for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill, agrees to any increase in expenditure payable out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund in consequence of the Act. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace, Iain Gray, Peter Peacock

S1M-2143 Angus MacKay: Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill: Financial Resolution—That the Parliament, for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill, agrees to any increase in expenditure payable out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund in consequence of the Act. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace, Iain Gray, Peter Peacock

S1M-2143 Angus MacKay: Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill: Financial Resolution-That the Parliament, for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill, agrees to any increase in expenditure payable out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund in consequence of the Act. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace, Iain Gray, Peter Peacock

S1M-2143 Angus MacKay: Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill: Financial Resolution-That the Parliament, for the purposes of any Act of the Scottish Parliament resulting from the Sexual Offences (Procedure and Evidence) (Scotland) Bill, agrees to any increase in expenditure payable out of the Scottish Consolidated Fund in consequence of the Act. Supported by: Mr Jim Wallace, Iain Gray, Peter Peacock
